entities.name: SYSTRAN
entities.description: A company focused on language technology, identified by its 'beyond language' tagline. This page details its IT Charter, outlining internal policies for data security, equipment usage, and network access.

entities.name: Internet Access
entities.description: Access to the public internet provided via SYSTRAN's network, subject to security policies, monitoring, and content restrictions.

entities.name: Intranet Access
entities.description: Access to SYSTRAN's internal network, subject to security policies.

Rules for users regarding data handling (reading, modifying, copying, destroying), professional data storage on personal equipment, private data storage on network drives, and systematic session locking.

Precautions for securing mobile information and communication devices, including authentication (password, fingerprint, facial recognition), limited local data storage on laptops, and physical anti-theft measures.
User identifiers are recorded when navigating the web, allowing visited site managers to link activity to SYSTRAN.
Access to certain sites, browser configuration, and file downloads may be restricted or prohibited for security reasons.
Prohibition of connecting to degrading, abusive, violent, racist, discriminatory, pornographic, defamatory, or publicly offensive sites.
Prohibition of using SYSTRAN's network to violate third-party intellectual or industrial property rights.
Users must immediately inform the IT service of any technical malfunction or anomaly.
